intro: Liabum domingense, commonly known as the Dominican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow or red center. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Liabum domingense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
